crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET HUNTING SUSPICIOUS Firesale gTLD EXE DL with no Referer June 13 2016
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert http $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET HUNTING SUSPICIOUS Firesale gTLD EXE DL with no Referer June 13 2016"; flow:established,to_server; http.uri; content:".exe"; nocase; fast_pattern; http.host; pcre:"/\.(?:s(?:(?:(?:cien|pa)c|it)e|tream)|c(?:l(?:ick|ub)|ountry|ricket)|m(?:(?:aiso|e)n|o(?:bi|m))|p(?:r(?:ess|o)|arty|ink|w)|r(?:e(?:[dn]|view)|acing)|w(?:eb(?:site|cam)|in)|b(?:(?:outiq|l)ue|id)|d(?:ownload|ate|esi)|(?:accountan|hos)t|l(?:o(?:an|l)|ink)|t(?:rade|ech|op)|v(?:oyage|ip)|g(?:dn|b)|online|faith|kim|xyz)(?:\x3a\d{1,5})?$/"; http.header_names; content:!"Referer"; content:!"Cookie"; classtype:trojan-activity; sid:2022896; rev:7; metadata:created_at 2016_06_14, performance_impact Moderate, confidence Medium, signature_severity Major, updated_at 2024_04_22, reviewed_at 2024_04_11;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET MALWARE Terse alphanumeric executable downloader high likelihood of being hostile
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert http $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET MALWARE Terse alphanumeric executable downloader high likelihood of being hostile"; flow:established,to_server; http.uri; content:"/"; content:".exe"; distance:1; within:8; fast_pattern; endswith; pcre:"/\/[A-Z]?[a-z]{1,3}[0-9]?\.exe$/"; http.header; content:!"koggames"; http.host; content:!"download.bitdefender.com"; endswith; content:!".appspot.com"; endswith; content:!"kaspersky.com"; endswith; content:!".sophosxl.net"; endswith; http.header_names; content:!"Referer"; nocase; classtype:bad-unknown; sid:2019714; rev:13; metadata:created_at 2014_11_15, performance_impact Significant, confidence Medium, signature_severity Informational, updated_at 2024_04_22;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET INFO Windows Powershell User-Agent Usage
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert http $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET INFO Windows Powershell User-Agent Usage"; flow:established,to_server; http.user_agent; content:"Mozilla/"; startswith; content:") WindowsPowerShell/"; distance:0; fast_pattern; classtype:not-suspicious; sid:2033355; rev:1; metadata:attack_target Client_Endpoint, created_at 2021_07_16, deployment Perimeter, confidence High, signature_severity Informational, updated_at 2021_07_16;)

threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

crowdsourced_ai_results.analysis:
The script starts by defining two variables: `exeUrl` which holds a URL to a file, and `exePath` which defines a path to save the downloaded file within the temporary directory, naming it `Updater.exe`.

Next, the script uses PowerShell to download the file from the URL defined in `exeUrl` and saves it to the path defined in `exePath`. The PowerShell window is hidden during the download.

Following the download attempt, the script checks if the file exists at the specified `exePath`. If the file exists, it prints a confirmation message to the console. Then, it executes the downloaded file using PowerShell with the `-ExecutionPolicy Bypass` parameter and hides the window. A message is printed confirming execution via PowerShell Bypass.

If the file does not exist at the specified path, it prints an error message to the console indicating that the download failed.

Finally, the script exits.
